services:
Home Assure Plus
The Right Solutions For The Right Reasons
HOME ASSURE PLUS is an exclusive set of eight services offered by 4Sight Inspections and is included with every Home Inspection at no extra charge. You will not find this level of commitment or confidence in Home Inspection Service anywhere else.

A sample of what HOME ASSURE PLUS provides:
Re-visit*
If repairs are negotiated as a direct result of the inspection performed and the inspection report provided by 4Sight Inspections we will revisit the property at your request and at a mutually convenient time to re-inspect the contractually repaired components to ensure the repair is complete and satisfactory.

Walk-a-way***
If there are major concerns found with the inspected house that cause you to walk away from the purchase agreement I will inspect the next home you place an offer on at half price. i.e. if second home had a rate of $375 then you would only pay $185.

30 Day Warranty
We offer a 30 Day Warranty for structural and mechanical components in the home at no extra charge. 

We provide home inspections, professional home inspectors, certified home inspectors, home inspection guarantee and the best home inspection service in the industry.

profile:
Baeumler Approved and a Certified Master Inspector, Bryce Rankin believes that knowing your home is key to making a good and safe investment for both you and your family. During the home inspection process clients are encouraged to follow along and ask questions. Being involved in this process gives clients a much better understanding of how the home operates and how to maintain it over the years.
Our detailed Home Inspections reports provide our clients with all the necessary information to make an informed home purchase. With digital reporting it is quick and easy to share your report with family, friends, or contractors to aid in any work or opinions that may be required to move forward comfortably with your investment. Technology is key. Thermal Imaging and Moisture Detection equipment used on all of our inspections can reveal defects that cannot be seen by the human eye. Revealing potential trouble spots throughout the home that can lead to significant cost and frustration down the road. In many cases these defects are hidden from view with a fresh coat of paint, drywall, or storage. Whether a home buyer, seller, or owner we can help. Online booking through our website is available 24/7 or you can contact Bryce Rankin at anytime to discuss your home inspection needs.

profile:
Giving you the peace of mind you need to make important property decisions since 2017

You can count on our professionals to deliver detailed and accurate home inspections and home energy audits! We’ve performed over 500 home inspections and over 2000 energy audits since we opened our doors in 2017. Whether you’re buying or selling your home, looking to participate in energy upgrade incentives, or you’re a real estate professional, AmeriSpec can help. Our team of certified commercial and residential home inspectors and registered energy advisors have the knowledge and resources to inspect your home professionally – giving you the peace of mind you need to make better decisions. 

HAVE YOUR PROPERTY INSPECTED BY OUR CERTIFIED INSPECTORS AND REGISTERED ENERGY ADVISORS!

Pre-purchase home inspection of residential homes and condominiums
Pre-listing home inspection of residential homes and condominiums
Commercial and multi-unit residential property assessment
Septic system inspection
Well and cistern pumped water system inspection

Registered energy advisors
Home energy audit

profile:
Homeworks Inspector will reduce the risk of unwanted surprises. Your Inspector will provide you with information regarding repairs and any defects with the home. He can help you with regular maintenance suggestions, and as a Homeworks Client our inspection team is available for calls regarding any questions you have for as long as you own your home.
 
Homeworks inspection services inspectors adhere to the strict standards of practice and the code of conduct of the Canadian Association of Home and Property Inspectors, the Ontario Association of Home Inspectors, as well as the International Association of Certified Home Inspectors.
  
HomeWorks inspector will provide you with valuable information regarding the roofing, exterior, structure, heating, cooling, insulation, plumbing, and the interior of your perspective real estate purchase or sale.

profile:
Whether you're buying or selling a home, having myself, a Professional Certified Home Inspector and Civil Engineer Technologist inspect the home, will give you peace of mind and assist you in making an informed real estate decision. I inspect your home with the identical effort and detail as I would if it were my own. I also take the extra steps above and beyond what others provide, to ensure you experience the most thorough home inspection possible, including walking on roofs, entering attics and crawlspaces, testing appliances etc. You are encouraged to join me during the inspection to observe and ask questions. You will gain knowledge of your home's features and learn about the components and systems that provide your enjoyment, safety, and comfort. After the onsite portion is complete, you will be sent a personalized, detailed, report in colour, complete with pictures in an easy to read format. After you have reviewed your report I’m always available for questions you may have, or to assist you with your home related issues. 
As a Civil Engineer Technologist, I have been trained in the theoretical applications of the structure, systems and components of a house and as a contractor for over 23 years I have worked on the practical applications of the systems that allow your home to function properly and safely.

To assist you with your home related problems all our inspections include a free subscription to the Home Owners Network.

Buyers Inspection (Pre-Sale Inspection):
Buying a home is one of the biggest investment decisions of your life. By having the home inspected by a Certified Home Inspector from Bluestone Home Inspection, you can minimize unpleasant surprises and difficulties after purchase. You will learn the positive points of a home, as well as the maintenance and upgrades that will be necessary to keep it in good shape. After the inspection, you will have a much clearer understanding of the property you are about to purchase, and you will be able to make a confident informed buying decision. A Bluestone Home Inspection prior to purchasing provides you with some of the most vital information needed to protect you and your family. Not understanding the true condition of your potential purchase can cost you thousands, not to mention countless hours of your time, as well as the unwanted stress involved. While you focus on the home's style, size layout, price and neighborhood, I take care of evaluating its major systems- like the plumbing, heating, cooling, electrical, and structure, making sure you have all the information before you make such a significant decision. You can count on Bluestone Home Inspection to give you the unbiased, professional inspection you need, when you need it.

Why should I get a pre-listing inspection?
A great many home sales are cancelled after a buyer's home inspection due to the buyers shock at the "functional condition" of the home. It may look great, but have serious technical, safety, or functional issues present without your knowledge. Having the home inspected before this happens is the ideal way to identify and either repair or disclose the issues found in the in an inspection

Listing inspections are also an excellent way for you as the homeowner to discover the true condition of your home. As an existing homeowner you may feel you know your home and its systems, but typically home owners are very surprised at what an inspection can reveal.
service_area: Providing Home Inspections in Hamilton, Burlington, Brantford, Grimsby, Caledonia, Milton, Oakville, Mississuaga, Dunnville, Simcoe, Welland, Beamsville, St Catharines, Vineland, Cambridge ...
hours: 8 am to 11 pm 7 days a week
services:
The Buyer Inspection (Pre-Purchase Inspection)

The Onsite Inspection
Your home inspection will typically range from 2-4 hours long, depending on the size and age of the home. You are encouraged to join me, observe and ask questions as the inspection is performed. You will gain knowledge of your home's features and learn about the components and systems that provide your enjoyment, safety, and comfort. As a certified home inspector I will evaluate these components, systems, and structures of the home, and will clearly explain the findings in easy to understand terms, providing you with the knowledge to make an informed real estate decision.

Post Inspection
After the onsite portion of the inspection is complete my work is still not done. A detailed, personalized, computer generated inspection report will be prepared and sent to you the within hours. The report is in full colour, complete with many of the pictures you saw me take, and in an easy to read format, documenting the items and issues discovered onsite. After you have reviewed the  report, I'm available for any questions you may have.

 Our commitment to you does not stop there. For as long as you own your home we're available to provide you with assistance and guidance with home related issues.

Seller's Inspection/Pre-Listing Inspection Advantages          

    Discloses any issues up front that will often times produce a higher net sales price, and eliminate you losing money by having to reduce the selling price by thousands as a result of the findings of the buyer's inspector.
    Allows you as the seller time to make repairs and shop for competitive contractors.
    Removes over-inflated buyer procured repair estimates or guestimates from the negotiation.
    Often precludes the buyer's having a separate inspection since the home has already been inspected.
    Eliminates buyer's remorse that often occurs just after a buyer’s inspection. Therefore the deal is less likely to fall apart the way they often do when a buyer's inspection unexpectedly reveals a problem.
    Lightens negotiations and can prevent costly 11th-hour renegotiations that may result in you losing money.
    Provides a third-party, unbiased opinion, that instills confidence in buyers.
    Displaying your report in your home for potential buyers is the ultimate gesture of openness on the part of you the seller.
    Allows your agent to send potential buyers agents the report before they view your home, Therefore buyers already know what to expect and gives you a far better opportunity to sell your home faster since you have already ‘pre-qualified’ the potential buyers
    Alerts you to any immediate safety issues found, before agents and potential buyers tour the home

The OverSeeIt program offers a variety of services:

    Project and contractor oversight.
    New construction phase inspections.
    Final walk-through inspections.
    Annual inspections for home and commercial property owners.
    Foreclosure inspections.
    Insurance inspections.
payment_method: Cheque, Cash or Bank Email Transfer
